Trial_Design.evidence: In this single-center, double-blind trial, 150 patients undergoing elective GLS were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive esketamine (0.25mg/kg, n=75) or sufentanil (0.1Î¼g/kg, n=75)

Objective.evidence: Esketamine, the dextrorotatory form of ketamine with analgesic, sedation and anti-inflammatory properties, was evaluated for PONV prophylaxis compared to sufentanil.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes were PONV incidence and severity in Postanesthesia care unit (PACU) and during 48 hours postoperation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: 150 patients undergoing elective GLS were randomized

Number_Randomised.evidence: 150 patients undergoing elective GLS were randomized

Result_Outcome.evidence: The esketamine group demonstrated significantly lower PONV incidence (in PACU: 57.3% vs 36%, p=0.014; 24h: 53.3% vs 36%, p=0.048) and reduced severity within 24 hours (in PACU, p<0.001; 6h, P=0.042; 24h, p=0.029).
